jealous.translation[0].definitions[0].de: feeling unhappy because someone has something that you wish you had
jealous.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Why are you so jealous of his success?
jealous.translation[0].definitions[1].de: feeling angry and unhappy because someone you like or love is showing interest in another person, or another person is showing interest in them
jealous.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: She gets jealous if I even look at another woman.
He was talking to Nina to make me jealous.
jealous.translation[0].note_box[0].items: Someone is jealous of someone or something
She was jealous of her sister
jealous.translation[0].note_box[1].secti: feeling unhappy because someone has something that you want and cannot have
Maybe he's jealous because I got the job and he didn't.
Sharon had always been jealous of her sister's long blonde hair.
wishing that you had something nice or special that someone else has
When I saw the garden, I was really envious.
She knew she was beautiful and enjoyed the envious looks of other women.
You'll be green with envy when you see their new house.
having a very strong desire to have something that someone else has
The King was a covetous and grasping man.
